Detailed Description

Abstract video encoder base class. The sub-classes of this class provide the actual video encoder functionality API. The VideoEncoder sub-class instances are accessed by the clients via the CodecManager API.
See also:
CodecManager::ObtainEncoder

CodecManager::ReleaseEncoder

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* VideoEncoder::CbVideoFrameEncoded)(ResultType result, void *context, UINT8 HUGE *out_buf, UINT32 out_buf_len_used, UINT32 time_stamp, FrameCodingType vop_coding_type)
 

Callback function that is invoked by the VideoEncoder when a frame has been encoded.

Parameters:
result A result (error) code: Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that has been passed to the VideoEncoder object when RegisterCallbackFunctions has been invoked.
out_buf Pointer to the video output buffer with the encoded frame.
out_buf_len_used Length of the video output buffer out_buf (in bytes).
time_stamp time stamp for the encoded frame
vop_coding_type The frame (VOP) coded type.
See also:
EncodeFrame

RegisterCallbackFunctions

Frame (VOP) coding type

Enumerator:
IFrame  I-frame or key frame.
PFrame  P-frame.
EndOfFrameCodingType 

Member Function Documentation

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::AllocateOutputBuffers (  UINT8 &  out_buf_count,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len
)  [pure virtual]
 

Allocates a number of output buffers that are used to store the encoded frames. Note: Output buffers will be freed when VideoEncoder::Stop is invoked.

Parameters:
out_buf_array On return, a pointer to the output buffer array (the elements of the array are pointers to the actual buffers).
out_buf_count Desired number of buffers to be allocated in the output buffer array. If set to 0, the default number of buffers will be allocated. On return, the actual number of buffers, i.e. the VideoEncoder adapt the number passed in by the caller if necessary.
out_buf_len On return, the length of one output buffer in bytes (all buffers have the same length). It corresponds to the maximum possible length of one encoded frame.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::Close (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Closes (releases) the video encoder opened by Open. This method should be invoked as soon as the video encoder is not needed anymore to allow other video encoders to access the resources.

Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an aprropriate error code.
See also:
Open

CodecManager::ReleaseEncoder

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::EncodeFrame (  UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  time_stamp,
UINT32  key_frame_ind
)  [pure virtual]
 

Encodes a video frame. This is done asynchronously, i.e., when the frame has been encoded, the callback function CbVideoFrameEncoded will be invoked.

Parameters:
in_buf Points to input raw video data.
time_stamp Number of primary time units elapsed since the start of encoding process. Time stamp value should be integral multiple of VideoEncoderParameters::m_timer_resolution/ VideoEncoderParameters::m_frame_rate (refer the details on VideoEncoderParameters).
key_frame_ind Flag indicating the insertion of I-frame. Possible values for this flag are: TRUE, FALSE. TRUE inserts the I-frame. Default value should be FALSE.
out_buf Buffer in which the encoded stream needs to be written. Enough buffer to hold the encoded stream corresponding to one frame of data should be given. The maximum frame size (i.e. encoding bytes) can be obtained by using GetParameters function.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameEncoded

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::FlushBuffers (  CbResult  cb_video_encoder_flushed,
void *  context
)  [pure virtual]
 

This function flushes all video encoder buffers.

Parameters:
cb_video_encoder_flushed Callback function that is called when this operation has finished.
context Context (e.g. this pointer) that is passed in the callback function.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CodecDevice::CbResult

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::GetCapabilities (  VideoCodecCapabilities &  caps  )  [pure virtual]
 

This function is used to retrieve the capabilities of the video encoder (VideoEncoder sub-class).

Parameters:
caps On return, it contains the capabilities. Note: The caller has to create this object (with arbitrary values) before calling this function. The passed object is then filled with the correct values by the VideoDecoder sub-class.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::GetConfigStream (  UINT8 HUGE *&  out_buf,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len
)  [pure virtual]
 

This function is used to get the configuration stream (header). after this configuration stream has been used, the corresponding buffer has to be freed by using VideoEncoder::ReleaseConfigStreamBuffer.

Parameters:
out_buf On return, pointer to a buffer where the config stream has been written to.
out_buf_len On return, length of out_buf (in bytes).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
ReleaseConfigStreamBuffer

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::InsertKeyFrame (   )  [pure virtual]
 

This function enforces the video encoder to insert an I frame, i.e. the next frame to be encoded shall be encoded as I frame.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::Open (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Opens the video encoder. In general, when a encoder is opened, it is reserved for the caller and cannot be used by another caller. Thus, as soon as the video encoder is not needed anymore, it shall be released by using Close.

Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an aprropriate error code.
See also:
Close

CodecManager::ObtainEncoder

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions (  void *  context,
CbVideoFrameEncoded  cb_video_frame_encoded
)  [pure virtual]
 

Register callback functions.

Parameters:
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that is valid for all callback functions registered with this instance of the VideoEncoder. This context is then passed as an argument of all callback functions invoked by the VideoEncoder.
cb_video_frame_encoded A pointer to a callback function that is invoked by the VideoEncoder each time when a frame has been encoded.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::ReleaseConfigStreamBuffer (  UINT8 HUGE *  buf  )  [pure virtual]
 

This function is used to release (free) the buffer used for providing the configuration stream (header) data.

Parameters:
buf Pointer to the buffer to be released.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
GetConfigStream

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::ReleaseOutputBuffer (  UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf  )  [pure virtual]
 

This function is used to release the output buffer of the encoder (buffer containing encoded frame data) so that it can be re-used for the next frame.

Parameters:
out_buf Pointer to the buffer to be released.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::SetConfig (  const VideoEncoderParameters &  params,
UINT32 &  out_buf_max_len
)  [pure virtual]
 

Configures the video encoder statically, i.e., when the decoder is not active.

Parameters:
params Video encoder parameters to be set.
out_buf_max_len On return, it contains the maximum length (in bytes) of the output buffer.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an aprropriate error code.

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::SetDynamicConfig (  VideoEncoderDynParameters &  params  )  [pure virtual]
 

Configures the video encoder dynamically, i.e., when the decoder is active.

Parameters:
params Video encoder parameters to be set.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an aprropriate error code.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::Start (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Starts the video frame encode. This is done asynchronously, i.e., when the frame has been encoded, the callback function CbVideoFrameEncoded will be invoked.

Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameEncoded

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.

virtual ResultType VideoEncoder::Stop (  CbResult  cb_video_encoder_stopped,
void *  context
)  [pure virtual]
 

Stops the video frame encode. This is done asynchronously, i.e., when the encoder has been encoded, the callback function cb_video_encoder_stopped will be invoked.

Parameters:
cb_video_encoder_stopped Callback function that is called when this operation has finished.
context Context (e.g. this pointer) that is passed in the callback function.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameEncoded

Implemented in AtiMpeg4Encoder, and EmzMpeg4Encoder.
